conbody.p: The following table presents all EDR tags generated for Lifecycle. Section provides sample EDRs for various scenarios. For different scenarios, a subset of the tags defined in the following table are generated.

row.entry: This attribute indicates the lifecycle record type.
This attribute indicates whether the subscription was added/renewed/reset successfully or not.

entry.p: If the result is fail, then this attribute provides the reason for failure.

Valid values: 0 (Not Enough Funds in Account), 1 (Account is Barred), 2 (Device is Barred), 3 (Device is in Final State), 4 (Group is Barred), 5 (Group is in Final State), 6 (All Device or Group Barred or Final), 10 (Account overage limit is greater than the reset value), 11 (Invalid Discount Percentage), 12 (Max Renewal Reached), 13 (No subscription exists with align bundle reference), 14 (Subscription(s) with align bundle reference is(are) barred), 15 (Activation time is greater than or equal to aligned expiry time), 16 (Reference bundle subscription is not active/attached to any Device and Group).

row.entry: This attribute indicates the triggering event that invoked the EDR.
This attribute indicates the type of the entity for which the lifecycle is triggered.
This attribute indicates the ID of the entity for which the lifecycle is triggered.
This attribute indicates the name of the transition occurred in the triggered lifecycle.
This attribute indicates the name of the state from which the transition starts.
This attribute indicates the name of the PERIOD lifecycle of the entity for which the lifecycle is triggered.
The bill cycle calendar applied for the reset action.
This attribute indicates the name of the ENTITY lifecycle of the entity for which the lifecycle is triggered.

entry.p: The reason for which the EDR was generated.

Valid values: AUDIT, API, ON_CALL, EVENTEVENT is generated if Renew Subscription Action with allow event broadcast flag is configured in Account Period Lifecycle and Subscription Renewed event with Accept Broadcast event flag is configured in a subscription Lifecycle.

row.entry: The time of the first event that occurs on the BCR date, recordOpeningTime.
This attribute indicates the time when the EDR is generated. It is presented in standard DD/MM/YYYY HH:MM:SS format.

Signifies the date and time of the CDR/EDR generation. This value is taken from the CDR module timestamp. By default, it is presented in standard DD/MM/YYYY HH:MM:SS format, as shown in the first example.
However, the format can be changed to include milliseconds as well, as shown in the second example. This value is in millisecond format with timezoneoffset. Since RecordTimestamp tag is generated in GMT time, timezone offset is +0000. For this, the ETCD key timestampInMS must be set to true. Contact Nokia Support to change any ETCD key.

li.p: Result of the triggering event that took place.
Begins the record related to another entity(s).

row.entry: This attribute indicates the ID of the bundle referred by the subscription.

entry.p: This attribute indicate the activation type of the bundle referred to by subscription. It can be either of following:

row.entry: This attribute indicates the ID of the account associated with the entity.
This attribute indicates the amount charged for renewing the subscription, including FeePerDevice (if any).
Specifies the identifier for the taxation profile.
Specifies the total tax amount charged to the account.
The percentage of discount on fee.
The discount value calculated on charge fee.
This attribute indicates the number of maximum renewals allowed for the subscription.
This attribute indicates the number of renewals left for the subscription.
This attribute indicates the amount charged for renewing the subscription, excluding FeePerDevice (if any).

entry.p: This attribute indicates the source of the subscription renewal fee that can be either of the following:

row.entry: This attribute indicates the fee charged per device when renewing the subscription (if any).

entry.p: This attribute indicates the property of the subscription which defines how a subscription is renewed to either of the following values:
This attribute indicates the ID of the device associated with the entity.
This tag is available if the subscription is attached to a device.
This attribute indicates the ID of the group associated with the entity, if present.
This tag is available if the subscription is attached to a group.

row.entry: This attribute indicates the source entity, used to calculate the billing cycle for subscription or account.
Indicates the time when the subscription will become active. Till that time, the subscription is not activated.

This attribute indicates the hour of day to which the entity is applicable.
A value of 24 indicates EXACT. This indicates that the time in end date and time is same as subscription start time.
A value of 25 indicates start of new day. The end date and time are aligned to 00:00:00 of next day, as per the lifecycle periodicity.

This attribute indicates the day of month to which the entity is applicable.
A value of 32 indicates EXACT. This indicates the day of month is same as the the subscription purchase date.

This attribute indicates the day of week to which the entity is applicable.
A value of 7 indicates EXACT. This indicates the day of week is same as the day of week of the subscription purchase date.
This attribute indicates the start date-time of the current billing cycle.
This attribute indicates the end date-time of the current billing cycle.

entry.p: For ResetAccountAction and RenewSubscriptionAction/ResetPeriodAction for Account entity this is the previous account start time.
For EmptySubscriptionAction, ResetSubscriptionAction, and RenewSubscriptionAction, ResetPeriodAction for Subscription entity this is the previous subscription start time.
For ResetAccountAction, RenewSubscriptionAction, ResetPeriodAction for Account entity, this is the previous account end time.
For EmptySubscriptionAction, ResetSubscriptionAction, RenewSubscriptionAction, ResetPeriodAction for Subscription entity this is subscription previous end time.

row.entry: Contains child tags with bucket information.
This attribute specifies the name of bucket being renewed or reset.
This attribute indicates the unit type of bucket, for example Bytes, KB, MB, or minutes. It is defined as per customer and type conversion defined by the operator.
This attribute indicates the type of bucket. It can be unit, volume, money, or time which are system defined.

If the CarryOverBucket is False, then the BucketBalanceBefore attribute is the remaining value of the main Bucket at reset or renewal. Otherwise, the BucketBalanceBefore attribute is the remaining value of carry over bucket after reset or renewal.

If the CarryOverBucket is False, then the BucketBalanceAfter attribute is the Initial Value of the main bucket after reset or renewal. Otherwise, the BucketBalanceAfter attribute is the Updated Initial Value of the carry over bucket after reset or renewal.

entry.p: This attribute indicates either of the following values:

ul.li: True: This value denotes that BucketInfo record is for carry over bucket.
False: This value denotes that BucketInfo record is for regular bucket.

entry.p: This attribute is available only when CarryOverBucket is equal to true and contains the value forwarded from the main bucket remaining balance to carry over bucket.

This attribute is also populated for the session call scenarios where the units were granted in last CCA before the reset or renewal time of subscription and a CCR-u is reported after the reset or renewal time containing a USU less than GSU.

The delta between GSU and USU (unused quantity of previous billing cycle) is calculated. The unused quantities are evaluated with respect to carry-over to check whether the unused quantities are eligible for carry-over considering all the carry-over feature rules. The carry-over bucket is updated and the CarryOverTRValue tag is filled with the carry-over amount. For example, if GSU is 100 MB and USU is 80 MB, then 20 MB is evaluated according to the carry-over. If 10 MB is eligible for carry-over, then this tag reports the same value. For non-monitory units, this tag has the base unit values, such as seconds for time or bytes for volume.

row.entry: Contains child tags with StepUp information.
Specifies the previous step up date and time.

entry.p: Specifies the latest step up date and time.
Specifies the previous step during reset/renew.

row.entry: This attribute indicate the account type for which action was triggered.
This attribute indicates the value to which account balance need to be reset.
The value of account balance before it is reset.
The value of account balance after it is reset.
Contains child tags with counter information.
Specifies the name of Counter updated by lifecycle logic.
Specifies the key of Counter updated by lifecycle logic.
Last saved signal state of counter if the counter is a policy counter.
Specifies the Type of the Counter selected by the tariff. Possible values are CALL, USAGE, COST.
Specifies the unit of the Counter (Bytes, KB, MB, Minutes, etc.). It is defined as per customer and type conversion.
Specifies the unit type of the Counter. It can be Unit, Volume, Money, or Time, which are system defined.

Specifies value of the Counter before request has been analyzed for charging and as per counter definition and counter type. For update of Money type counter, DB precision is followed. Counter values are shown in base units (seconds for Time and bytes for Volume).

Specifies the value of the Counter after the request has been analyzed and as per configurable counter definition. For update of Money type counter, DB precision is followed. Counter values are shown in base units (seconds for Time and bytes for Volume).
Record property/block for each subscriber ID.
Source of custom data like Device/Group.
Record property/block for custom data information.
This tag is available for aggregate counters.
Attach mode of aggregate counter, for example, Device, Group, Device_Group, and so on.
This is generated for lifecycle action triggered for subscription entity.
This is generated for lifecycle action triggered for subscription entity.

table.title: Applicability of tags for various events - 1
Applicability of tags for various events - 2
Applicability of tags for various events - 3
